variant.name: .Jpeg
variant.summary: Byte size of JPEG images that fall into this category.

variant.name: .WebP
variant.summary: Byte size of WebP images that fall into this category.

histogram.name: Blink.Accessibility.Bundle
histogram.summary: Tracks when combinations of mode flags are set. Records when the accessibility mode flag changes and aligns with one of the common (named) flag bundles. Bundles that do not match a named set fall into the unnamed bucket.

histogram.name: Blink.Accessibility.ModeFlag
histogram.summary: Tracks whether individual accessibility mode flags are set. Recorded when each mode flag is flipped from false to true. Only tracks usage within web content.

histogram.name: Blink.Accessibility.NumTreeUpdatesQueuedBeforeLayout
histogram.summary: Records how many tree updates were queued at the time updates are being processed after layout. If we are trying to process too many updates at once, we should investigate how we might be able to merge similar updates without losing important information.

histogram.name: Blink.Accessibility.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating accessibility in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.AnchorElementMetricsIntersectionObserver.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle where the observation is for gathering information about anchor elements within the visible viewport. Recorded when an intersection observation attributed to anchor element metrics is updated.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.Animate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent processing main frame animations during a main frame update.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note that the histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.Animation.CompositedAnimationFailureReason
histogram.summary:
Reasons an Animation is not suitable for running on the compositor thread.
Note that a given Animation may have more than one reason, so this histogram cannot be used to determine the overall rate of 'composited' vs 'noncomposited' animations.

histogram.name: Blink.Animation.SDA.BoundaryMisalignment
histogram.summary: Unexpected misalignment of a phase boundary when aligned to a scroll- boundary measured in 16ths of a pixel. Recorded each time phase calculation determines the animation is in the before or after phase when a scroll- driven animation has determined that the before-active or active-after boundary is aligned to the bounds of the scroll range.

histogram.name: Blink.AutomaticLazyFrameLoad.Reason
histogram.summary: Records if the frame is eligible for automatic lazy-load mechanisms. This is recorded when each frame having a url in the page is created.

histogram.name: Blink.AutomaticLazyLoadFrame
histogram.summary:
Records if the automatic lazy-load for selected performance problematic iframes is applied or not. This is recorded when each frame having a url in the page is created. See HTMLFrameOwnerElement::LazyLoadIfPossible() for more details.
Note: There are two groups that lazy-load isn't applied. One group is simply the feature itself is disabled, another groupd is that feature is enabled, but there are no targeted frames on the page.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.2DLayerBridge.Compression.DecompressionTime
histogram.summary: When a compressed hibernated 2D canvas snapshot is decompressed, duration in ms. Reported each time a canvas snapshot is decompressed.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.2DLayerBridge.Compression.Ratio
histogram.summary: When a hibernated 2D canvas snapshot is compressed, the compression ratio achieved. Reported each time a canvas snapshot is compressed.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.2DLayerBridge.Compression.SnapshotSizeKb
histogram.summary: When a hibernated 2D canvas snapshot is compressed, the size before compression. Reported each time a canvas snapshot is compressed.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.2DLayerBridge.WillReadFrequently
histogram.summary: Records the state of the willReadFrequently flag upon creation of a Canvas2D layer bridge, as this is the moment when it determines whether the canvas will be accelerated.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.2DPrintingAsVector
histogram.summary: Records if a Canvas is being printed as a vector or as an image.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.CanvasColorCache.Effectiveness
histogram.summary: Records the effectiveness of the canvas color cache. The value is a percentage of requests for a color where the color was in the cache. For example, a value of 25% means 1 out of every 4 requests for a color was available. As this code may be called extensively, the value is logged on every 1000th request to the cache. This means the last 0-999 values are not recorded, and similarly, if the cache is accessed less than 1000 times nothing is logged.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ContentChangeMode
histogram.summary: Records whether the contents in the canvas buffer needed to be preserved via a copy when replacing the target buffer for drawing a new frame. This metric is recorded each time the target buffer needs to be replaced. It's recorded once per frame.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.CreateImageBitmapSource
histogram.summary: The source from which an ImageBitmap is created by a createImageBitmap call.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.GetImageData.WillReadFrequently
histogram.summary: Records the state of the willReadFrequently flag during Canvas2D readback.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.GPUFallbackToCPU
histogram.summary: Logs the occurrences of canvas fallback from GPU to CPU.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.HasRendered
histogram.summary: Records if the canvas has been rendered at least once. Recorded on disposal.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.HibernationEvents
histogram.summary: Records the occurrence of events related to 2D canvas GPU resource hibernation.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.MaximumInflightResources
histogram.summary: Reports the maximum number or canvas resources used at any one time by a canvas resource provider. Logged in the destructor of CanvasResourceProvider.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.MaximumStateStackDepth
histogram.summary: Reports the maximum depth of the state stack over the lifetime of a 2d rendering context. Metric is recorded once per instance of CanvasRenderingContext2D, OffscreenRenderingContext2D, and PaintRenderingContext2D; at context destruction time.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.NumCanvasesPerPage
histogram.summary: When a Document is shutdown, reports the number of canvases on that page.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.OverdrawOp
histogram.summary: Counts 2d canvas draw operations that trigger the overdraw optimization.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.RasterDuration{BlinkCanvasRasterDurationType}
histogram.summary:
Records the CPU, GPU and combined raster time for a random sampling of canvas frames for accelerated and deferred canvases. Records wall time for a random sampling of unaccelerated canvases.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution. {BlinkCanvasRasterDurationType}

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.RequestedImageMimeTypes{CanvasRequestedImageMimeTypeFunctions}
histogram.summary: Records the occurence of image file formats passed into toDataURL and toBlob functions in canvas. {CanvasRequestedImageMimeTypeFunctions}

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ResourceProviderIsAccelerated
histogram.summary: Logs if the canvas resource provider is accelerated or not.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ResourceProviderType
histogram.summary: Records the type of resource provider used for a canvas.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ResourceProviderUsage
histogram.summary: Records the requested resource usage for a canvas resource provider.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.SqrtNumberOfPixels
histogram.summary: Stores the square root of the number of pixels in a new or resized offscreen canvas. Emitted from CanvasRenderingContextHost::RecordCanvasSizeToUMA.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.IdleTaskStatus
histogram.summary:
Records the status of the idle task when finishing a toBlob call.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.InitialEncodingDelay.{Type}
histogram.summary:
A new version of "Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.InitiateEncodingDelay" (which will be allowed to expire) which allows for times >10ms.
This metric measures the time spent from initiating image encoding (jpeg or png) on idle task to the actual execution time of initiation, as part of a canvas.toBlob API call.
This metric is useful in helping us adjust the IdleTaskStartTimeoutDelay in canvas.toBlob. When the initialization idle task is delayed for longer than IdleTaskStartTimeoutDelay, the browser will switch to a non-idle task to force initialization and encoding to occur on the main thread.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.ScaledDuration{BlinkCanvasToBlobType}
Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.TotalEncodingDelay.{Type}
histogram.summary:
A new version of "Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.InitiateEncodingDelay" (which will be allowed to expire) which allows for times >10ms.
This metric measures the total time spent on completing encoding all the rows of an image (jpeg or png), as part of a canvas.toBlob API call. Encoding occurs during one or more idle periods on the main thread and the waiting time of the next idle period is included in the measurement. If the code has swtiched to force encoding path, we will not measure the delay in this metric.
This metric is useful in helping us adjust the IdleTaskCompleteTimeoutDelay in canvas.toBlob. When the encoding idle task is delayed for longer than IdleTaskCompleteTimeoutDelay, the browser will switch to a non-idle task to force encoding to happen on the main thread.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToDataURLScaledDuration{BlinkCanvasToDataURLMimeType}
Blink.Canvas.VectorPrintFallbackReason
histogram.summary: The reason why printing a 2D canvas failed to use vector printing.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.WebGPUMaxRecycledResourcesCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of total unused recyclable WebGPU resources since last clean-up. Logged in the WebGPU recyclable resouce clean-up timer function.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.WebGPUMaxRecycledResourcesInKB
histogram.summary: The maximum size of total unused recyclable WebGPU resources in KB since last clean-up. Logged in the WebGPU recyclable resouce clean-up timer function.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.WebGPUStaleResourceCount
histogram.summary: The number of stale recyclable WebGPU canvas resources released and logged in the WebGPU recyclable resouce clean-up timer function.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorGamut.Destination
histogram.summary: Gamut properties of destination color space.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination
histogram.summary: Gamma properties of destination color space.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.NonlinearFitErrorCombined
histogram.summary: The L-infinity error (in 8-bit values) of the numerical approximation of table-based ICC profile transfer functions for all channels combined, when the nonlinear approximation converged.

histogram.name: Blink.CompositingCommit.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating and pushing layers at the end of the paint step in the Blink document lifecycle. This is implemented by PaintArtifactCompositor.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.CompositingInputs.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating compositing inputs in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.Compositor.MemoryLimitKb
histogram.summary: Amount of memory the compositor is allowed to use. Collected once per process, on Android only.

histogram.name: Blink.Compression.CompressionStream.Format
histogram.summary: Compression format passed to the constructor of the JavaScript API "CompressionStream", which is used for lossless compression of arbitrary binary data. Recorded once per call to the constructor. This measures which compression formats are most commonly used in the wild.

histogram.name: Blink.Compression.DecompressionStream.Format
histogram.summary: Compression format passed to the constructor of the JavaScript API "DecompressionStream", which is used for lossless decompression of arbitrary binary data. Recorded once per call to the constructor. This measures which compression formats are most commonly used in the wild.

histogram.name: Blink.ContentDocumentUpdate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent preparing the document for a canvas draw, SVG image draw or plugin during a main frame update. Includes time spent in style update and layout.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.ContextMenu.ImageSelection.Depth
histogram.summary:
The depth of the discovered image node in the hit test list when performing a penetrating image selection search.
Only recorded when a user long presses or right clicks a document (and an image is found).

histogram.name: Blink.ContextMenu.ImageSelection.ElapsedTime
histogram.summary:
The amount of time it took to iterate through the dom looking for an image node.
Only recorded when a user long presses or right clicks a document.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.ContextMenu.ImageSelection.Outcome
histogram.summary:
The outcome of an image selection search that may or may not trigger the context menu.
Only recorded when a user long presses or right clicks a document (and an image is found).

histogram.name: Blink.ContextMenu.ImageSelection.RetrievalOutcome
histogram.summary:
The outcome of a follow up retrieval of an image node after a selection has occurred, which occurs asynchronously and thus could be unsuccessful due to changes that may occur between the initial hit test and the retrieval.
Only recorded when a user long presses or right clicks a document (and an image is found).

histogram.name: Blink.CSSStyleSheetResource.ParseTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent for parsing the stylesheet. Recorded when the stylesheet finishes loading and does not have cached stylesheet contents.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.CSSStyleSheetResource.TokenizeTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent for tokenizing the stylesheet. Recorded when the response body of the stylesheet is received.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.CullRect.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating the cull rect in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.AvifDensity.Count.{ImageArea}
histogram.summary: The number of images per image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel for image size in {ImageArea} megapixels. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for 8-bit AVIF color still images without alpha.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.AvifDensity.KiBWeighted2
histogram.summary: The compressed image size in KiB per image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for 8-bit AVIF still images with at least 100 pixels on the smallest dimension (width or height). The reported count for a sample represents the image size rounded to the nearest KiB.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.JpegDensity.Count.{ImageArea}
histogram.summary: The number of images per image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel for image size in {ImageArea} megapixels. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for JPEG non-grayscale images.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.JpegDensity.KiBWeighted
histogram.summary: The compressed image size in KiB per image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for JPEGs with at least 100 pixels on the smallest dimension (width or height). The reported count for a sample represents the image size rounded to the nearest KiB.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.WebPDensity.Count.{ImageArea}
histogram.summary: The number of images per image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel for image size in {ImageArea} megapixels. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for WebP lossy still images without alpha.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.WebPDensity.KiBWeighted2
histogram.summary: The compressed image size in KiB per image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for WebP still images with at least 100 pixels on the smallest dimension (width or height). The reported count for a sample represents the image size rounded to the nearest KiB.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.WebPFileFormat
histogram.summary: WebP file format parsed during Blink's header parsing phase (which should happen only once per image).

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImageType
histogram.summary: Image codec inferred during decode. The histogram is incremented when enough of the image has been downloaded to infer its width and height. Animated images are counted only once, regardless of how many frames there are.

histogram.name: Blink.DisplayLockIntersectionObserver.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle where the observation is for Display Locking. Recorded when an intersection observation is made for the Display Locking reason.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.EffectiveZoom
histogram.summary: The EffectiveZoom as reported by ComputedStyle in a Blink renderer. The value is reported each time the effective zoom is set to a new value. The maximum zoom reported is 400% to keep the histogram of reasonable size.

histogram.name: Blink.Element.Fullscreen.DurationUpTo1H.Popup
histogram.summary: The duration of a fullscreen session initiated by a fullscreen popup request, up to 1 hour. The value is reported each time HTML fullscreen mode exits after it was initiated by a fullscreen popup.

histogram.name: Blink.Element.Fullscreen.DurationUpTo1H.RequestFullscreen
histogram.summary: The duration of a fullscreen session initiated by a element.{webkit}requestFullscreen request, up to 1 hour. The value is reported each time HTML fullscreen mode exits after it was initiated by element.{webkit}requestFullscreen. Excludes XR fullscreen.

histogram.name: Blink.EnvironmentIntegrity.Latency
histogram.summary: The latency of resolved calls to the navigator.getWebEnvironmentIntegrity()

histogram.name: Blink.EnvironmentIntegrity.Result
histogram.summary: The results of all calls to navigator.getWebEnvironmentIntegrity()

histogram.name: Blink.Experimental.Cookies.CacheLookupResult2
histogram.summary:
Whether a GetCookiesString request for a document returned the same result as the previous one. This is an experiment to determine the usefulness of a cookie cache in the Renderer.
A sample is recorded for every GetCookiesString request sent from the Document owned CookieJar.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.AccountsDialogShown
histogram.summary: Records a 1 each time an accounts dialog is shown.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.AccountsRequestSent
histogram.summary: Records a 1 each time a request is sent to the accounts endpoint.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.ApprovedClientsExistence
histogram.summary: Records whether an IDP returns an approved clients list in the response. Records at most one sample per API call.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.ApprovedClientsSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the approved clients list returned by IDP if applicable. Records at most one sample per API call.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.AutoReauthn.BlockedByContentSettings
histogram.summary: Records whether the FedCM auto re-authn call is blocked because the auto re-authn content settings permission is disabled. Records at most one sample per FedCM API with auto re-authn enabled: some failures could occur before this metric is recorded.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.AutoReauthn.BlockedByEmbargo
histogram.summary: Records whether the FedCM auto re-authn call is blocked because the auto re-authn is under embargo, i.e. due to cooldown. Records at most one sample per FedCM API with auto re-authn enabled: some failures could occur before this metric is recorded.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.AutoReauthn.BlockedByPreventSilentAccess
histogram.summary: Records whether the FedCM auto re-authn call is blocked because preventSilentAccess() has been called on this site. Records at most one sample per FedCM API with auto re-authn enabled: some failures could occur before this metric is recorded.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.AutoReauthn.ReturningAccounts
histogram.summary: Records whether there was zero, one, or multiple returning accounts when a site calls the FedCM API with autoReauthn: true. Records at most one sample per failed API call: some failures could occur before this metric is recorded.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.AutoReauthn.Succeeded
histogram.summary: Records whether auto re-authn checks succeeded or not. The count would provide roughly the number of FedCM re-authn attempts, the true count would provide the number of times the re-authn UI is shown to the user, and the false count would provide the number of attempts where auto re-authn was blocked for some non-network related reason. Records at most one sample per FedCM API with auto re-authn enabled: some failures could occur before this metric is recorded.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.AutoReauthn.TimeFromEmbargoWhenBlocked
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time that has passed from the time the FedCM auto re-authn API was embargoed to the time in which the next call occurs. Only records a sample when there is an auto re-authn FedCM API call which is blocked due to embargo. Samples are exponentially bucketed, with a max bucket of 10 minutes, the embargo duration (see `kFederatedIdentityAutoReauthnEmbargoDuration`).

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.CancelReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that the FedCM dialog was closed (ex user clicked the dialog close button). Recorded when the FedCM dialog is closed without the user selecting an account. This includes instances where the close action is less intentional such as the virtual keyboard showing trigerring the dialog close.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.ClosedSheetType.Android
histogram.summary: Records the type of FedCM Android UI sheet that is being displayed when the user manually closes it. Records when the user closes this dialog, so at most once per API call that results in UI being shown.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.ClosedSheetType.Desktop
histogram.summary: Records the type of FedCM desktop UI sheet that is being displayed when the user manually closes it. Records when the user closes this dialog, so at most once per API call that results in UI being shown.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.CloseVerifySheet.Android
histogram.summary: Records whether the UI that a user is closing is the verify sheet or not on Android. Records at most one sample per API call.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.CloseVerifySheet.Desktop
histogram.summary: Records whether the UI that a user is closing is the verify sheet or not on desktop. Records at most one sample per API call.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Error.ErrorDialogResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the error dialog. Recorded at most once per API call when the error dialog is displayed.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Error.ErrorDialogType
histogram.summary: Records the type of error dialog shown. Recorded at most once per API call

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Error.ErrorUrlType
histogram.summary: Records whether the error URL is same-origin, cross-origin but same-site or cross-site with the config URL. Recorded at most once per API call when a valid error URL is received.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Error.TokenResponseType
histogram.summary: Records the type of token response received. Recorded at most once per API call when a token response received.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.IdpSigninRequestInitiatedByUser
histogram.summary: Whenever we receive an IDP sign-in header (Google-Accounts-SignIn or IdP-SignIn-Status: action=signin) in response to a non-worker HTTP request, this records whether there was a transient user activation as indicated by ResourceRequest::has_user_gesture.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.IdpSigninStatus.ClosePopupWindowReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the pop-up window is closed. Recorded once per opening of a pop-up window.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.IdpSigninStatus.IdpClosePopupToBrowserShowAccountsDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when IdentityProvider.close() is called to when an updated accounts dialog is shown. Recorded once per IdentityProvider.close() being called given that an accounts dialog is shown. It is not recorded when the accounts dialog is never shown.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.IdpSigninStatus.MismatchDialogResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the mismatch dialog. Recorded once per the mismatch dialog being displayed.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.IdpSigninStatus.PopupWindowResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the IDP sign-in pop-up window. Recorded once per pop-up window triggered by the user.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.IdpSigninStatus.ShowPopupWindowResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of attempting to show a pop-up window, triggered by the user clicking on the "Continue" button on the IDP sign-in status mismatch dialog. Recorded once per click of the "Continue" button.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.IdpSignoutRequestInitiatedByUser
histogram.summary: Whenever we receive an IDP sign-in header (Google-Accounts-SignOut or IdP-SignIn-Status: action=signout) in response to a non-worker HTTP request, this records whether there was a transient user activation as indicated by ResourceRequest::has_user_gesture.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.IsAfterWindowOnload
histogram.summary: Records whether the FedCM request is made before or after the start of the window onload event. Records once per API call when the FedCmMultipleIdentityProviders flag is disabled.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.IsSignInUser
histogram.summary: Records whether the user selected account is for sign-in or not. Records at most one sample per API call.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.LoginHint
histogram.summary: Records the number of accounts the match a login hint. Records at the time the accounts received by the FedCM API are filtered.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.MismatchDialogShown
histogram.summary: Records a 1 each time a mismatch dialog is shown.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.NumRequestsPerDocument
histogram.summary: Records the number of navigator.credentials.get() requests made in a document. Requests made when FedCM is disabled, when there is a pending FedCM request or for the purpose of MDocs or multi-IDP are not counted. Records at most one sample for every document where at least one navigator.credentials.get() request is made. No samples are recorded if the count is 0. The bucketing method used is base::UmaHistogramCounts100.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.PreventSilentAccessFrameType
histogram.summary: Records the type of frame that invokes preventSilentAccess(). Records only when there is an existing FedCM sharing permission on the main frame, and some frame in the page invokes the preventSilentAccess() JavaScript call. Possible values are: main frame, same-site iframe, and cross-site iframe, where the site of the iframe is compared with the site of the main frame.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.RpContext
histogram.summary: Records the RP Context used in a FedCM call. Records only when the RP Context flag is enabled.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.SetLoginStatusIgnored
histogram.summary: Records the reason why we ignored an attempt to set a login status. Recorded once per attempt to set a login status that was ignored.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.SignInStatusSetToSignout.NetError
histogram.summary: Records the NetError from the accounts list endpoint. This histogram is only recorded when the IDP Sign-In Status of an IDP is marked as signout as a result of the accounts list endpoint not returning any accounts.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.SignUp.PrivacyPolicyClicked
histogram.summary: Recorded each time that the privacy-policy link in the FedCM prompt is clicked.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.SignUp.TermsOfServiceClicked
histogram.summary: Recorded each time that the terms-of-service link in the FedCM prompt is clicked.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Status.AccountsResponseInvalidReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason why there is no valid account in the response. Recorded at most once per accounts fetch when the response is received.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Status.Csp
histogram.summary: Records the result of CSP checks in the FedCM API.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Status.IdpSigninMatch
histogram.summary: Records whether the browser's knowledge of whether the user is signed-in to the IDP based on observing signin/signout HTTP headers matches the information returned by the accounts endpoint. Recorded at most once per navigator.credentials.get() call after sending the request to the accounts endpoint.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Status.MediationRequirement
histogram.summary: Records the mediation requirement of a request token call to the FedCM API. Records a sample when the FedCM call is completed, i.e. at the same time as Blink.FedCm.Status.RequestIdToken.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Status.RequestIdToken
histogram.summary: Records the status of a request token call to the FedCM API.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Status.Revoke
histogram.obsolete: Revoke is deprecated. Removed in June 2022.
histogram.summary: Records the status of a revoke call to the FedCM API.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Status.Revoke2
histogram.summary: Records the status of a revoke call to the FedCM API. Recorded once per IdentityCredential.revoke() call, once the browser knows the result.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Status.SignInStateMatch
histogram.summary: Records whether user sign-in states between IDP and browser match. Records a sample after browser receives an account list from IDP prior to showing UI.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Timing.AccountsDialogShownDuration2
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when an accounts dialog is shown to when dialog is destroyed e.g. user selects an account, user closes the dialog, or the developer aborts the request. This duration includes the time when the accounts dialog is inactive e.g. user switches to a different tab. Samples are at most 10 minutes. Records a sample when an accounts dialog which is not the verifying UI for auto re-authentication is shown. In a previous definition, Blink.FedCm.Timing.AccountsDialogShownDuration, a sample was recorded when an accounts dialog (including the verifying UI) is shown.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Timing.CancelOnDialog
histogram.summary: Records the time from when the accounts dialog is shown to when the user explicitly closes the dialog without selecting any account. Only records a sample when the user sees and *explicitly* closes the dialog. For instance, the accounts dialog being closed as a result of the user focusing a different part of the browser UI does not count as explicitly closing the dialog.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Timing.ContinueOnDialog
histogram.summary: Records the time from when the accounts dialog is shown to when the user presses the Continue button. Only records a sample when the user sees and taps the "Continue" button on the dialog.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Timing.IdTokenResponse
histogram.summary: Records the time from when the user presses the Continue button to when the token response is received. Only records a sample when the token response is received.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Timing.MismatchDialogShownDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when a mismatch dialog is shown to when user triggers IDP sign-in pop-up window or when dialog is destroyed e.g. user closes the dialog. This duration includes the time when the mismatch dialog is inactive e.g. user switches to a different tab. Samples are at most 10 minutes. Records a sample when a mismatch dialog is shown.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Timing.PostTaskDelayDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when RequestToken is called directly in navigator.credentials.get to when RequestToken would be called if invoked through a posted task. Records once per API call when the FedCmMultipleIdentityProviders flag is disabled and RequestToken is called during or after the window onload event. If RequestToken is called before the window onload event, Blink.FedCm.Timing.WindowOnloadDelayDuration is recorded instead.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Timing.ShowAccountsDialog
histogram.summary: Records the time from when a call to the API was made to when the accounts dialog is shown. Only records a sample when the dialog is shown.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Timing.TurnaroundTime
histogram.summary: Records the overall time from when the API is called to when the token response is received. Only records a sample when the token response is received.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.Timing.WindowOnloadDelayDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when RequestToken is called directly in navigator.credentials.get to when RequestToken would be called if invoked through a window onload event listener. Records once per API call when the FedCmMultipleIdentityProviders flag is disabled and RequestToken is called prior to the start of the window onload event. If RequestToken is called during or after the window onload event, Blink.FedCm.Timing.PostTaskDelayDuration is recorded instead.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.UserInfo.NumAccounts
histogram.summary: Records the number of accounts returned by a getUserInfo() call. Records once per request with a successful accounts fetch. Records when the request is completed.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.UserInfo.Status
histogram.summary: Records the status of a getUserInfo() call. Records once per request when the request is completed, right before running the callback.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.UserInfo.TimeToRequestCompleted
histogram.summary: Records the time from when a getUserInfo() call is received on the browser process to the time it is completed. Records once per request with a successful accounts fetch. Records when the request is completed.

histogram.name: Blink.FedCm.WebContentsVisible
histogram.summary: Records whether the WebContents is visible when the browser is ready to show the accounts dialog to the user. Records at most one sample per API call.

histogram.name: Blink.FencedFrame.CreationOrNavigationOutcome
histogram.summary: Records creation and navigation outcomes for a fenced frame. This is written either when a fenced frame navigates successfully, or when some issue causes either the creation or navigation of a fenced frame to stop.

histogram.name: Blink.FencedFrame.FailedSandboxLoadInTopLevelFrame
histogram.summary: If a fenced frame failed to load due to incorrectly set sandbox flags, records whether or not the fenced frame was attempting to be created in a top-level frame. This is written whenever a fenced frame creation fails due to sandbox flags not being permissive enough.

histogram.name: Blink.FencedFrame.IsFrameResizedAfterSizeFrozen
histogram.summary: Records if a fenced frame's size is set after the size had been frozen. The size of a fenced frame is frozen once it navigates to a page, and results in the inner contents being scaled to fit the new dimensions without telling it the frame's new size. This is only logged up to one time throughout a fenced frame's life, and will not be logged if the size is never set after being frozen.

histogram.name: Blink.FencedFrame.IsOpaqueFrameSizeCoerced
histogram.summary: Records whether an opaque-ads fenced frame's size was changed because the provided size was not in the list of allowed sizes. This will not log anything for a default mode fenced frame. This will log when an opaque-ads fenced frame has its size frozen (which is triggered when it navigates to its first page).

histogram.name: Blink.FencedFrame.MandatoryUnsandboxedFlagsSandboxed
histogram.summary: If a fenced frame failed to load due to incorrectly set sandbox flags, records which sandbox flags that should be unsandboxed ended up being sandboxed, causing the load to fail. This is written whenever a fenced frame creation fails due to sandbox flags not being permissive enough. If multiple sandbox flags are incorrectly set, it will log every sandbox flag that was not set correctly for each failed load.

histogram.name: Blink.Fetch.KeepAlive.AfterDetached.Duration
histogram.summary:
The total microseconds spent between the calls to ResourceFetcher::ClearContext and ResourceFetcher::RemoveResourceLoader, roughly stands for how long a fetch keepalive request stays after the environment (document/context) is gone, including both success and failure.
The duration is recorded within ResourceFetcher::RemoveResourceLoader when the fetcher is already detached.

histogram.name: Blink.Fetch.KeepAlive.AfterDetached.IsSuccess
histogram.summary: Records true when loading a fetch keepalive request succeeds after ResourceFetcher is detached; Records false if the load fails.

histogram.name: Blink.Fetch.KeepAlive.Total
histogram.summary: Records true when an attempt is made to prepare to load a fetch keepalive request.

histogram.name: Blink.Fetch.KeepAlive.Total.IsSuccess
histogram.summary:
Records true when a successful attempt is made to load a fetch keepalive request; Records false if the load fails.
Note that the sum of the two buckets may still be smaller than Blink.Fetch.KeepAlive.Total, as the requests that were early-terminated due to quota exceeded may not be logged here.

histogram.name: Blink.Fetch.RequestResourceTime2{Scheme}
histogram.summary:
The total microseconds spent in ResourceFetcher::requestResource for {Scheme}.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.FetchQueuedPreloadsTime.{FrameType}.{IsInitial}
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to fetch queued subresource preloads for a document in a {FrameType}. Logged every time preloads need to be fetched after the {IsInitial} preload scan.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.DecodeTime
histogram.summary: Time spent for decoding the fonts. Recorded when a font resource creates its decoded data. This histogram is only logged in platforms with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.EmojiClusterBrokenness
histogram.summary: Percentage of emoji clusters of all emoji clusters going through shaping calls that are shaped as either .notdef/tofu glyphs or are shapes as more than one glyph, which usually indicates that an emoji sequence was not shaped correctly due to the emoji font not supporting it. Recorded per page/worker and on page unload if the page contained emoji.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.VariableFontsRatio
histogram.summary: Tracks adoption ratio of variable fonts compared to conventional (in the sense of non-variable) web fonts. Recorded at the time of instantiating a Skia SkTypeface from the successfully decoded web font blob.

histogram.name: Blink.ForcedStyleAndLayout.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing layouts due to Javascript value requests. Specifically, time spent in Blink Document::UpdateStyleAndLayout.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.Frame.GetCanonicalUrlRendererTime
histogram.summary: Android only: The time spent by the renderer main thread to collect and send back to the browser process a web page's canonical link. This is recorded every time the renderer fulfills a request for this information. This histogram is only logged in platforms with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HandleInputEvents.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent processing rAF-aligned input during a main frame update.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.HitTestDocumentUpdate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent preparing the document for hit testing during a main frame update. It does not compute the actual hit test time, rather the style, layout, compositing, etc time to prepare for the test.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.AbortedParseSize
histogram.summary: Number of bytes after which the html fast-path parser aborted. This does not count the bytes the fast-path parser did not look at. We measure this since aborting the fast-path and falling back to the normal parser is wasted effort. This is recorded after every invocation of Element::setInnerHTML.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.AbortedParseTime2
histogram.summary:
The amount of time the innerHTML fast-path parser took before reaching input it could not handle. This is recorded when Element::setInnerHTML is called, and at the moment when the input it can't handle is reached.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.ParseResult
histogram.summary: Captures the result of the innerHTML fast-path parser. This is recorded every time Element::setInnerHTML is called and only if the innerHTML fast-path parser is enabled.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.SuccessfulParseSize
histogram.summary: Number of bytes successfully parsed by the innerHTML fast-path parser. This is recorded if the innerHTML fast-path parser completes successfully and is logged at the end of parsing the content supplied to Element::setInnerHTML.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.SuccessfulParseTime2
histogram.summary:
The time it takes for the innerHTML fast-path parser to complete processing text from Element::setInnerHTML. This is recorded if fast-path innerHTML is enabled, and completes successfully.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.TotalParseTime2
histogram.summary:
The total time it takes to complete parsing of Element::setInnerHTML. This includes the time taken by the fast-path parser (even if it failed). This is recorded after every invocation of Element::setInnerHTML.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.{Type}.CompositeMaskV2
histogram.summary: This is logged if the innerHTML fast-path parser fails because an {Type} tag is encountered. This value is an aggregate (bitmask) that identifies which {Type} groupings were encountered. Ideally a single bitmask would be logged, but the dashboard doesn't deal well with large bitmasks. The individual groupings are recorded via one of Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.*.Mask0-3 (* is one of UnsupportedContextTag or UnsupportedTag).

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.{Type}.Mask{MaskBit}V2
histogram.summary:
See description of Blink.HTMLFastPathParser.*.CompositeMask for an overview of this including when it is logged. The value is a bitmask that identifies which tags were encountered:
{MaskBit}

variant.summary: bit 0: img. bit 1: aside. bit 2: u. bit 3: hr. bit 4: h. bit 5: em. bit 6: The tag is not a known html tag. bit 7: The tag is a known html tag, but is not categorized.

bit 0: form. bit 1: Any one of article, header, footer, or section. bit 2: nav. bit 3: iframe. bit 4: Any one of table, tr, td, tbody, or th. bit 5: Any of of dl, dt, or dd. bit 6: ins bit 7: blockquote.
bit 0: center. bit 1: small. bit 2: font. bit 3: fieldset. bit 4: textarea. bit 5: time. bit 6: svg. bit7: body.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ChunkCount4
histogram.summary:
The number of chunks parsed while loading a page. Each chunk represents a piece of the HTML content that can be loaded without blocking or yielding. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.InputCharacterCount4
histogram.summary:
The number of characters processed while parsing a document during page load. This is computed as the sum of all the characters appended to the input string sequence for the parser. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ParsingTimeMax4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the maximum time used to parse a single chunk before being blocked, yielding or completing, in microseconds. This does not include time spent executing script. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ParsingTimeMin4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the minimum time used to parse a single chunk before being blocked, yielding or completing, in microseconds. This does not include time spent executing script. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ParsingTimeTotal4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the total amount of time spent in the HTMLDocumentParser performing parsing, in microseconds. This does not include time spent executing script. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TimeToDeferredPumpTokenizer4
histogram.summary:
The time between when the first content has been received by the HTMLDocumentParser and when parsing begins. This is effectively measuring the time between when SchedulePumpTokenizer() is called, and when the task runs that does the parsing. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedAverage4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the average number of tokens parsed across all chunks. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedMax4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the maximum number of tokens parsed as a chunk. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedMin4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the minimum number of tokens parsed as a chunk. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedTotal4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the total number of tokens parsed across all chunks. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.YieldedTimeAverage4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the average time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will not be recorded if only one chunk was parsed. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.YieldedTimeMax4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the maximum time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will not be recorded if only one chunk was parsed. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.YieldedTimeMin4
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the minimum time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will not be recorded if only one chunk was parsed. This is only reported for http/https urls.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.Avif.CleanAperture
histogram.summary: If an AVIF image has a clean aperture ('clap') property, record what kind of clean aperture it is when one frame of the image is decoded fully. The histogram is intended to check whether clean aperture properties with a nonzero origin are common.

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.ImageHasMultipleGeneratorClientIds
histogram.summary: This histogram records whether an image has been decoded by a single client or by multiple clients during decoding. For an image to be decoded, it is always requested by a client with a client_id. If an image has been requested by multiple clients, it would be decoded more than once. The histogram value is recorded at most two times per image (once per bucket). There will be overlap for two buckets, but we can get the the number of an image decodeded by only one client with the difference between two buckets. This helps us to know how often images get duplicated decoding in real life.

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.IncrementalDecodeNeeded
histogram.summary:
For JPEG and WebP images, whether all image data has been received before decoding begins or whether we are still receiving data and will need to send partial image data to the decoder and pause/resume decoding until complete.
It is emitted when the DeferredImageDecoder is about to create the first DecodingImageGenerator for an image.

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.Jpeg.Area
histogram.summary: Number of pixels in a decoded JPEG image. Recorded after decoding is done by Blink's JPEG decoder (as opposed to, possibly, a hardware decode accelerator). Tracking the image area may include degenerate cases, e.g., an image with area = 10000 and dimensions = 1x10000. However, it is reasonable to assume these cases are relatively rare and the area of the image can serve as a proxy of how useful a decode accelerator can be (the larger the area, the better).

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.Jpeg.ColorSpace
histogram.summary: JPEG color space of a decoded image as guessed by libjpeg_turbo. Recorded after decoding is done by Blink's JPEG decoder (as opposed to, possibly, a hardware decode accelerator). When the color space is YCbCr, the chroma subsampling is also recorded.

histogram.name: Blink.ImplCompositorCommit.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating layers in the compositor thread during a ProxyMain::BeginMainFrame. It is the actual work time, excluding time spent waiting for the compositor thread to begin.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.Input.GestureScrollBeginAsCursorControl
histogram.obsolete: Cursor Control feature is launched, the metrics is no longer needed. Removed in March 2022.
histogram.summary: Records if a GestureScrollBegin is for cursor control.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObseration.FrameMinScrollDeltaToUpdateX
histogram.summary: Reports LocalFrameView::min_scroll_delta_to_update_intersection_.x() after an intersection observation update. The frequency is the same as Blink.UpdateViewportIntersection.UpdateTime.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObseration.MinScrollDeltaToUpdateX
histogram.summary: Reports IntersectionGeometry::min_scroll_delta_to_update_.x() after an intersection observation update. The frequency is number of geometry observers per frame times the frequency of Blink.UpdateViewportIntersection.UpdateTime.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObservation.FrameMinScrollDeltaToUpdateY
histogram.summary: Reports LocalFrameView::min_scroll_delta_to_update_intersection_.y() after an intersection observation update. The frequency is the same as Blink.UpdateViewportIntersection.UpdateTime.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObservation.MinScrollDeltaToUpdateY
histogram.summary: Reports IntersectionGeometry::min_scroll_delta_to_update_.y() after an intersection observation update. The frequency is the same as Blink.IntersectionObservation.MinScrollDeltaToUpdateY.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObservation.StateOnScroll
histogram.summary: Reports LocalFrameView::IntersectionObservationState after a scroll. This is reported on each scroll of any scroller.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObservation.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObservation.UsesCachedRects
histogram.summary: Reports if an intersection observer update uses cached rects. The frequency is the same as Blink.IntersectionObservation.MinScrollDeltaToUpdateY.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObservationInternalCount.UpdateTime
histogram.summary: Number of IntersectionObserver computations for blink-internal consumers that were performed during the course of a single main frame.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObservationJavascriptCount.UpdateTime
histogram.summary: Number of IntersectionObserver computations for javascript consumers that were performed during the course of a single main frame.

histogram.name: Blink.JavascriptDocumentUpdate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent preparing the document to answer a Javascript API query or request. Examples include scrool offset requests, queries of layout dimensions, SVG path queries, etc. Includes time spent in style update and layout, or via EnsurePaintLocationDataValidForNode. Some of these calls may be servicing internal needs, but we have no way to disambiguate those from JS driven activity.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.JavascriptIntersectionObserver.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle where the observation is due to a Javascript request. Recorded when an intersection observation is made for the Javascript reason.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.KeyboardLock.MethodCalled
histogram.summary: Records each call to the navigator.keyboard{Lock|Unlock} methods.

histogram.name: Blink.Layout.RebuildFragmentTreeSpine
histogram.summary: Time spent to rebuild container physical fragments, recorded on sub-tree root layout.

histogram.name: Blink.Layout.UpdateLayerPositionsAfterLayout
histogram.summary:
Time spent in PaintLayer::UpdateLayerPositionsAfterLayout.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.Layout.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating layout in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.LazyLoadedImage.Size
histogram.summary: Total network response size for each lazy loaded image that has loaded. This is recorded at the point that the image element completes loading. This includes all entries in `Blink.LazyLoadedImageBeforeDocumentOnLoad.Size` as well as lazy loaded images that load after document load.

histogram.name: Blink.LazyLoadedImageBeforeDocumentOnLoad.Size
histogram.summary: Total network response size for each lazy loaded image that has loaded before the document has finished loading. This is recorded at the point that the image element completes loading.

histogram.name: Blink.LazyLoadIntersectionObserver.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle where the observation is due to a Lazy Image Loading request. Recorded when an intersection observation is made to determine when a lazy loaded image should be loaded.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.LCPElementLocatorSize
histogram.summary:
Measures the size of the identified LCP element locator in bytes.
The metric is emitted before the element locator is serialized to the LCP Critical Path Predictor (LCPP) database, so it can inform us if the current ElementLocator encoding scheme is reasonable in terms of its output size.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.LCPInfluencerUrlsCount
histogram.summary:
Measures the number of resources identified to be influencing the load of the LCP element.
The metric is emitted before the influencer list is serialized to the LCP Critical Path Predictor (LCPP) database.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.LCPInfluencerUrlsMaxLength
histogram.summary:
Measures the size of the longest URL influencing the load of the LCP element.
The metric is emitted before the influencer list is serialized to the LCP Critical Path Predictor (LCPP) database.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.LCPInfluencerUrlsPredictionMatchCount
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of URLs matched during a subsequent page load, from the set of URLs identified to be influencing the load of the LCP element.
The metric is emitted as LCP Critical Path Predictor calculates dependencies of the current LCP candidate.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.LCPInfluencerUrlsPredictionMatchPercent
histogram.summary:
Measures the percent of matched LCP influencer URLs against the predicted set of URLs.
The metric is emitted as LCP Critical Path Predictor calculates dependencies of the current LCP candidate.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.PotentiallyLCPResourcePriorityBoosts
histogram.summary:
Measures the number of resources that got priority boost from LCPP signals for page loads with non-empty LCPP hint data.
This metric is emitted for every page load when it is about to emit "onload" event. The metric would tell us how much LCP Critical Path Predictor (LCPP), is affecting page load in the wild.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.PrefetchFontCount
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of font URLs to be prefetched using the LCPP prediction.
This metric is emitted when predicted font URLs are appended to the PreconnectPrediction structure for prefetching.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.PreloadedFontCount
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of fetched font URLs to be preloaded in the renderer using the LCPP prediction.
This metric is emitted just after the fonts are preloaded.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.RecordedFontCount
histogram.summary:
Measures the number of web fonts that was fetched in the page and recorded to the LCPP database.
This metric is emitted for every page load when it is about to emit "onload" event. Unlike Blink.LCPP.ReportedFontCount, this metric counts the number of fonts after filitering with the max fonts per site.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.RecordedFontUrlMatchCount
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of fetched font URLs that are already recorded in the LCPP database.
This metric is emitted for every page load when it is about to emit "onload" event.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.RecordedFontUrlPredictionMatchPercent
histogram.summary:
Measures the percent of font URLs in the LCPP database against all fetched font URLs.
This metric is emitted for every page load when it is about to emit "onload" event.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.RecordedFontUrlsMaxLength
histogram.summary:
Measures the longest font URL that was fetched in the page and recorded to the LCPP database.
This metric is emitted for every page load when it is about to emit "onload" event.

histogram.name: Blink.LCPP.ReportedFontCount
histogram.summary:
Measures the number of web fonts that was fetched in the page.
This metric is emitted for every page load when it is about to emit "onload" event.

histogram.name: Blink.Loading.CachedResponseArrivalAtRenderer
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to get a cached response. Recorded when the response arrives, and recorded only when both of the response and the code cache were cached.

histogram.name: Blink.Loading.CodeCacheArrivalAtRenderer
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to get a code cache. Recorded when the response arrives, and recorded only when both of the response and the code cache were cached.

histogram.name: Blink.LocalFrameRoot.DidReachFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: Reports if a local frame root ever receives a FirstContentfulPaint signal. Only recorded for local frame roots that run at least one main frame update.

histogram.name: Blink.LocalFrameRoot.DidReachFirstContentfulPaint.MainFrame
histogram.summary: Reports if the main frame ever receives a FirstContentfulPaint signal. Only recorded for main frame local frame roots that run at least one main frame update.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.MediaIntersectionObserver.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle where the observation is for a media element. Recorded when an intersection observation is made attributed to a media element (such as video auto-play).
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.CrossDocumentCachedResource2
histogram.summary:
Type of cached non-static resources reused across Documents when loading a new document in the same renderer. Recorded by the ResourceFetcher when a resource is requested for a new document and is not static. If the resource is available from the memory cache and previously loaded by a different document, the resource will be considered as reused. Repetitive requests to the same url in a document will be counted only once.
Warning: an unexpected reorder happened in Apr 2021 (https://crrev.com/c/2798954). Please do not trust older reports.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.PageSavedResourceStrongReferenceSize
histogram.summary: Size of the resource strong references saved to the memory cache. Recorded when the user navigates to a newpage under the same origin. Recorded only with feature flag MemoryCacheStrongReference.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.Remote.IsInCache.{Destination}
histogram.summary: Records whether a cached response exists in another renderer that has the same process isolation policies. Recorded when ResourceFetcher fetches a resource from network. This histogram is for `{Destination}` destination.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.Remote.{Visibility}.{LifecycleState}.IPCRecvDelay
histogram.summary:
Records the time between when a renderer receives an IPC to look for cached response and when another renderer receives the response of that IPC. The IPC is sent when ResourceFetcher fetches a resource from network. Recorded when the renderer receives the response.
Note: This histogram is not recorded on low-resolution clock clients.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.Remote.{Visibility}.{LifecycleState}.IPCSendDelay
histogram.summary:
Records the time between when a renderer sends an IPC to look for cached response and when another renderer receives that IPC. The IPC is sent when ResourceFetcher fetches a resource from network. Recorded when the renderer receives the response.
Note: This histogram is not recorded on low-resolution clock clients.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.AsyncScript
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for non-preloading requests of async and defer scripts. https://crbug.com/1043679 https://crbug.com/1376866 Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021/10/25 to 2022/12/09; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.Dead.{ResourceType}
histogram.summary:
RevalidationPolicy used for requests that hit Resource only referenced from MemoryCache for each resource type ({ResourceType}). https://crbug.com/579496 Requests counted by this are also counted by Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy or Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.Preload. https://crbug.com/1376866
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-04-21 to 2022-12-09; data may be missing. This histogram's {ResourceType} was broken until 2023-03-09; data before the date may not be stored.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.Preload.{ResourceType}
histogram.summary:
RevalidationPolicy used for preloading requests for each resource type ({ResourceType}). https://crbug.com/579496 https://crbug.com/1376866
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-04-21 to 2022-12-09; data may be missing. This histogram's {ResourceType} was broken until 2023-03-09; data before the date may not be stored.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.{ResourceType}
histogram.summary:
RevalidationPolicy used for non-preloading requests for each resource type. https://crbug.com/579496 https://crbug.com/1376866
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-04-21 to 2022-12-09; data may be missing. This histogram's {ResourceType} was broken until 2023-03-09; data before the date may not be stored.

histogram.name: Blink.MobileMetrics.BadTapTargetRatioExtractionSucceed
histogram.summary: Whether element extraction phase succeed without consuming entire 4ms time budget in MobileFriendlinessChecker::ComputeBadTapTargetsRatio() evaluation. This metric recorded at 5 seconds after first MainFrame's commit and periodically every 1 minutes after that.

histogram.name: Blink.MobileMetrics.BadTapTargetRatioTime
histogram.summary:
The time taken in MobileFriendliness::ComputebadTapTargetsRatio evalution. This metric recorded at 5 seconds after first MainFrame's commit and periodically every 1 minutes after that.
The histogram does not record metric on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.NotificationManager.GetPermissionStatusTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to query the notification permission status. This is recorded each time a sync call is made.

histogram.name: Blink.OffscreenCanvas.NewOffscreenCanvas
histogram.summary: Records the creation of a new offscreen canvas in OffscreenCanvas::Create.

histogram.name: Blink.OffscreenCanvas.SqrtNumberOfPixels
histogram.summary: Stores the square root of the number of pixels in a new or resized offscreen canvas. Emitted from CanvasRenderingContextHost::RecordCanvasSizeToUMA.

histogram.name: Blink.OffscreenCanvas.TransferControlToOffscreen
histogram.summary: Records a call to transfer a canvas offscreen.

histogram.name: Blink.OffscreenCanvas.Transferred
histogram.summary: Records when an offscreen canvas has been transferred from the main thread to a worker.

histogram.name: Blink.Overflow.ReplacedElementAreaOutsideContentRect
histogram.summary: Computes the area of img, video or canvas elements which is painted outside the content rect if 'overflow' property is respected on these elements.

histogram.name: Blink.Paint.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating paint in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.ParseStyleSheet.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent parsing style sheets for a document. Only recorded when the CSSParserContext has a document available.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.Plugin.UpdateTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to update the plugin list. This can happen, for example, during Navigator.plugins.get.

histogram.name: Blink.PreloadRequestWaitTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the creation of a PreloadRequest to when PreloadRequest::Start is called. Logged for each PreloadRequest::Start call.

histogram.name: Blink.PrePaint.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating paint properties and paint invalidation in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: PreFCP metrics will be recorded even if FCP is not reached, whereas AggregatedPreFCP metrics are only recorded if FCP is reached.
Note: Not recorded on ~5% of Windows machines with low-resolution clocks.
Note: The histograms with PreFCP/PostFCP/AggregatedPreFCP suffixes before 105.0.5175.0 were impacted by https://crbug.com/1330675. Be careful when aggregating or comparing these histograms across the version.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceRequest.BackgroundResourceFetchSupportStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether BackgroundURLLoader can handle the resource request, and the reason why it can't handle the request. Logged for every resource request from the page which is not controlled by a service worker.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceRequest.CompletionDelay
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when a resource request completes to when the renderer is notified. Logged for every resource request.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceRequest.RedirectDelay
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when a redirect from a resource request happens to when the renderer is notified. Logged for every resource request redirect.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceRequest.ResponseDelay
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when a response from a resource request is started to when the renderer is notified. Logged for every resource request.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceRequest.StartDelay
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when the renderer starts a resource request to when it is actually started on the network. Logged for every resource request.

histogram.name: Blink.Responsiveness.UserInteraction.MaxEventDuration.{InteractionType}
histogram.summary:
The duration of a single user interaction: https://web.dev/better-responsiveness-metric/#group-events-into-interactions
This metric is emitted once for every interaction in the web contents {InteractionType}

variant.name: AllTypes
variant.summary: of all interaction types (keyboard, click, tap, drag). The maximum event duration for the keydown, keypress, keyup, pointerdown, pointerup, mousedown, mouseup, and click event is reported.

variant.name: Drag
variant.summary: of type drag. The maximum event duration for the pointerdown, pointerup, mousedown, mouseup, and click event is reported.

variant.name: Keyboard
variant.summary: of type keyboard. The maximum event duration for the keydown, keypress, and keyup event is reported.

variant.name: TapOrClick
variant.summary: of type click or tap. The maximum event duration for the pointerdown, pointerup, mousedown, mouseup, and click event is reported.

histogram.name: Blink.ScanAndPreloadTime.{FrameType}.{IsInitial}
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to scan and preload subresources for a document in a {FrameType}. Logged every time the {IsInitial} preload scan is performed.

histogram.name: Blink.ScanPendingActivityDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to scan pending activities of all V8 wrappers in a worker thread.

histogram.name: Blink.Script.AsyncScriptCount
histogram.summary: The total number of async scripts associated with a document at the time parsing has finished.

histogram.name: Blink.Script.ForceDeferredScripts.Mainframe
